title: Drawing, "Design for a candelabrum", ca. 1810
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and sepia wash, black ink on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in ink, lower center: Adam; lower right: 3[...illegible]
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A woman standing on a column supports both handles of a stand with seven sockets (meant to be eleven) holding burning candles. Four sockets are decorated with lion heads and other three with stylized foliage. Lower right, perspective diagram shows all eleven sockets with arms; left is scale.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a candelabrum", ca. 1810.
ca. 1810. Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and sepia wash, black ink on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-503.
